pullRequest.body:
+ Introduce typeclass `DecompositionMonoid`, which says every element in the monoid is primal, i.e., whenever an element divides a product `b * c`, it can be factored into a product such that the factors divides `b` and `c` respectively. A domain is called pre-Schreier if its multiplicative monoid is a decomposition monoid, and these are more general than GCD domains.

+ Show that any `GCDMonoid` is a `DecompositionMonoid`. In order for lemmas about `DecompositionMonoid`s to automatically apply to `UniqueFactorizationMonoid`s, we add instances from `UniqueFactorizationMonoid α` to `Nonempty (NormalizedGCDMonoid α)` to `Nonempty (GCDMonoid α)` to `DecompositionMonoid α`. ([Zulip](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/144837-PR-reviews/topic/non-normalizable.20gcd_monoid/near/316895209)) See the bottom of message for an updated diagram of classes and instances.

+ Introduce binary predicate `IsRelPrime` which says that the only common divisors of the two elements are units. Replace previous occurrences in mathlib by this predicate.

+ Duplicate all lemmas about `IsCoprime` in Coprime/Basic (except three lemmas about smul) to `IsRelPrime`. Due to import constraints, they are spread into three files Algebra/Divisibility/Units (including key lemmas assuming DecompositionMonoid), GroupWithZero/Divisibility, and Coprime/Basic.

+ Show `IsCoprime` always imply `IsRelPrime` and is equivalent to it in Bezout rings. To reduce duplication, the definition of Bezout rings and the GCDMonoid instance are moved from RingTheory/Bezout to RingTheory/PrincipalIdealDomain, and some results in PrincipalIdealDomain are generalized to Bezout rings.

+ Remove the recently added file Squarefree/UniqueFactorizationMonoid and place the results appropriately within Squarefree/Basic. All results are generalized to DecompositionMonoid or weaker except the last one.

[Zulip](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/217875-Is-there-code-for-X.3F/topic/Coprime.20if.20product.20is.20squarefree/near/419334520)

With this PR, all the following instances (indicated by arrows) now work; this PR fills the central part.
```
                                                                          EuclideanDomain (bundled)
                                                                              ↙          ↖
                                                                 IsPrincipalIdealRing ← Field (bundled)
                                                                            ↓             ↓
         NormalizationMonoid ←          NormalizedGCDMonoid → GCDMonoid  IsBezout ← ValuationRing ← DiscreteValuationRing
                   ↓                             ↓                 ↘       ↙
Nonempty NormalizationMonoid ← Nonempty NormalizedGCDMonoid →  Nonempty GCDMonoid → IsIntegrallyClosed
                                                 ↑                    ↓
                    WfDvdMonoid ← UniqueFactorizationMonoid → DecompositionMonoid
                                                 ↑
                                       IsPrincipalIdealRing
```

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body: !bench

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/0dbdbf5c-2014-47a6-b028-b40ccfab96f6) for commit bbd6ec0069227f3bd3267e5af731e33d377a7a75.
There were [no significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/c981a1b7-4dea-4cfd-a929-1332076644ed/to/0dbdbf5c-2014-47a6-b028-b40ccfab96f6) against commit 963467adad9608bd1e7e7723d362a689588aa09c.

Strangely, CI isn't happy with the deleted file. I created [another branch](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/compare/DecompositionMonoid_test?expand=1) to test the effect of restoring the file.

:v: alreadydone can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
Can you briefly explain in the PR description what the motivation here is; that is, mention a `DecompositionMonoid` that is not a `GCDMonoid`?
I'm now mentioning Schreier domains in the PR description. For a Schreier domain that is not a GCD domain, see (for example) https://math.stackexchange.com/a/1485146/12932
bors r+

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7877823476/job/21494784877)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7877823476/job/21494784342)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7877823476/job/21494784694)

Thanks :tada: 

If CI passes, please remove the label `awaiting-CI` and merge this yourself, by adding a comment `bors r+`.

bors d+

Thank you for doing this, it's a heroic effort and a much-needed improvement to this part of the library.

As I said elsewhere I think the new definition `IsRelPrime` deserves to own the `IsCoprime` name and I think what is currently called `IsCoprime` could be renamed to something like `IsBezoutPair` or `ExistsBezout`.

IMHO this can come later though.
Thanks for the quick reviews! Took a bit long for me to get back to this ...
Thanks for the quick reviews! It took a bit long for me to get back to this ...

Thanks :tada: 

If CI passes, please remove the label `awaiting-CI` and merge this yourself, by adding a comment `bors r+`.

bors d+

I suppose that Lean is smart enough to not include the `DecompositionMonoid` instance in this statement? But I would like to have a bit more of a formal guarantee, even if that means duplicating a bit of code...
Okay, moved the variables into statements.
Golf, sweet golf!
The golf doesn't depend on any new material, but the original proof is obviously too long, so I golfed it since I'm adding a lemma next to it ...
Is the docstring no longer relevant?
Let me restore it; the referenced lemma is for PIDs and is now proved using this one.

Setting things up so that we can state lemmas which take a parameter `[Nonempty MyTypeclass]` is an unusual pattern for us. I suppose the alternative would be to introduce two new typeclasses `NormalizableMonoid` and `NormalizableGCDMonoid` like we do for `MetrizableSpace`.

I think I prefer what you propose but I just wanted to mention this.

I think MetrizableSpace is necessary because MetricSpace is not a mixin (it extends TopologicalSpace) so it needs to assert not only the existence of a metric but also its compatibility with an existing TopologicalSpace instance, and you can't do the latter with pre-existing typeclasses. ([Zulip discussion](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/144837-PR-reviews/topic/non-normalizable.20gcd_monoid/near/316895209) about `Nonempty GCDMonoid` etc.)
I see, thanks!

```suggestion
namespace IsRelPrime

variable {m n : ℕ}

theorem pow_left (H : IsRelPrime x y) : IsRelPrime (x ^ m) y := by
```
etc.

This will also fix the long line below.
Done, thanks!

```suggestion
/-- A choice of gcd of two elements in a Bezout domain.

Note that the choice is usually not unique. -/
```

This will help the occasional `nontriviality α` technique:
```suggestion

theorem subsingleton_of_isRelPrime_zero_zero (h : IsRelPrime (0 : α) 0) : Subsingleton α := by
  contrapose h
  rw [not_subsingleton_iff_nontrivial] at h
  exact not_isRelPrime_zero_zero

```
Really? I think `nontriviality α` *assumes* `Subsingleton α` and tries to prove the goal. I'm not convinced it's useful and there wasn't a corresponding IsCoprime lemma.
LOL, of course!

How about upgrading this to an iff (and fixing the name):
```suggestion
theorem isRelPrime_iff_forall_dvd_not_prime_of_ne_zero {a b : R} (ha : a ≠ 0) :
    IsRelPrime a b ↔ ∀ ⦃d⦄, d ∣ a → d ∣ b → ¬ Prime d :=
```

There are plenty of lemmas with `no_...factors` in the name and I think they're pretty intuitive and almost established a certain kind of convention, so I'm only changed `no_factors` to `isRelPrime` and upgrade to iff. Notice that [isCoprime_of_prime_dvd](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/RingTheory/PrincipalIdealDomain.html#isCoprime_of_prime_dvd) etc. are similar lemmas that are not iff.
Given that this would be a rename, I certainly don't insist but I do think these `no_...factors` names should be tidied up one day.

```suggestion
/-! `IsRelPrime` enjoys desirable properties in a decomposition monoid.
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: introduce `IsRelPrime` and `DecompositionMonoid` and refactor

IMHO this can come later though.
